summary.title: DeepSeek-V3.1-Terminus Now on Model Garden
summary.summary: The DeepSeek-V3.1-Terminus model is now accessible via Model Garden, offering new capabilities for users.

2025-09-15.content:
**Vector Search indexes optimized for storage (Preview)**

Storage-optimized Vector Search offers a cost-effective solution for searching massive datasets. This new tier is ideal for large-scale RAG and semantic search applications, and simplifies development with a new auto-tuning feature that eliminates the need to manage the underlying index configuration. This feature is available in Preview.

For more information, see [Storage-optimized Vector Search](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/vector-search/storage-optimized-vector-search).

summary.title: Storage-optimized Vector Search
summary.summary: Introducing a cost-effective solution for massive datasets. Ideal for large-scale RAG and semantic search, it simplifies development with auto-tuning. Available in Preview.

2025-09-10.content:
**Vertex AI Agent Engine**

Agent Engine now supports the following features:

* Agent Engine **Code Execution**, now in Preview, lets your agent run code in an isolated sandbox environment. For more information, see [Code Execution](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/agent-engine/code-execution/overview).
* You can now develop, deploy, and use agents that support the **Agent-to-Agent (A2A) protocol** on Agent Engine. For more information, see [Develop an Agent2Agent agent](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/agent-engine/develop/a2a).
* Agent Engine now supports **bidirectional streaming**. For more information, see [Bidirectional streaming](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/agent-engine/bidirectional-streaming).
* The [Agent Engine page](https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/agents/agent-engines) in the Cloud Console UI now has a new **Memory Bank** tab for displaying and managing memories.

summary.title: New Features for Vertex AI Agent Engine
summary.summary: Vertex AI Agent Engine introduces exciting new capabilities including Code Execution for running code in a sandbox, support for the Agent-to-Agent (A2A) protocol, and bidirectional streaming. Additionally, a new Memory Bank tab is now available in the Cloud Console for managing agent memories.

2025-09-10.content:
**Vertex AI Agent Engine**

In version `v1.112.0` of the Vertex AI SDK for Python, the `agent_engines` module has been refactored to a [client-based design](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/agent-engine/overview#migration). For information about updating your existing code to the new design, see the [Migration guide](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/deprecations/agent-engine-migration).

summary.title: Vertex AI Agent Engine Update
summary.summary: The Vertex AI SDK for Python has refactored its agent_engines module to a client-based design in version v1.112.0. Refer to the migration guide for instructions on updating your code.

2025-09-09.content: [EmbeddingGemma](https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/publishers/google/model-garden/embeddinggemma) and [DeepSeek-V3.1](https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/publishers/deepseek-ai/model-garden/deepseek-v3-1) models are available through Model Garden.

summary.title: New Models Available on Model Garden
summary.summary: EmbeddingGemma and DeepSeek-V3.1 models are now accessible via Model Garden.

2025-09-09.content: [AI Singapore's SEA-LION V4 models](https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/publishers/aisingapore/model-garden/gemma-sea-lion-v4) are available through Model Garden. They are open models for Southeast Asian languages, built by leveraging Vertex Model Development Service for enhanced training efficiency and model accuracy.

summary.title: SEA-LION V4 Models Now in Model Garden
summary.summary: AI Singapore's SEA-LION V4 models are now accessible via Model Garden. These open models cater to Southeast Asian languages and were developed using Vertex Model Development Service for improved training and accuracy.

2025-08-21.content:
**Vertex AI Agent Engine**

Agent Engine now supports the following enterprise security features:

* You can now deploy your agents in a private VPC environment, configuring a Private Service Connect interface, to ensure data privacy and meet security and compliance requirements. For more information, see [Configure Private Service Connect interface](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/agent-engine/deploy#psc-i).
* You can now use your own [customer-managed encryption keys (CMEK)](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/agent-engine/manage/access#cmek) to protect data at rest.
* You can now specify [customized resource controls](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/agent-engine/deploy#customized-resource-controls), such as the minimum and maximum number of application instances, resource limits for each container, and concurrency for each container.
* As a part of Vertex AI Platform, Vertex AI Agent Engine now supports [HIPAA](https://cloud.google.com/security/compliance/hipaa) workloads.

For more information, see [Agent Engine overview](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/agent-engine/overview#enterprise_security).

summary.title: New Security Features for Vertex AI Agent Engine
summary.summary: Secure your AI agents with new enterprise features, including private VPC deployment, customer-managed encryption keys, customized resource controls, and HIPAA compliance.

2025-08-14.content: [Gemma 3 270M](https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/publishers/google/model-garden/gemma3;publisherModelVersion=gemma-3-270m-it), [Wan 2.2](https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/publishers/wan-ai/model-garden/wan2-2) and [Wan 2.1](https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/publishers/wan-ai/model-garden/wan2-1) models are available through Model Garden.

2025-07-16.content: Added [Gemma 3](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/vertex-ai-samples/blob/main/notebooks/community/model_garden/model_garden_axolotl_gemma3_finetuning.ipynb) fine-tuning notebook using Axolotl docker with support for 1b, 4b, 12b, and 27b variants.

summary.title: Gemma 3 Fine-Tuning Notebook Added
summary.summary: We have added a new notebook that allows you to fine-tune Gemma 3 models using Axolotl. This notebook supports all Gemma 3 variants, including 1b, 4b, 12b, and 27b.

2025-07-14.content: [Multimodal MedGemma 27B IT](https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/publishers/google/model-garden/medgemma;publisherModelVersion=medgemma-27b-it), [MedSigLIP](https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/publishers/google/model-garden/medsiglip), and [T5Gemma](https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/publishers/google/model-garden/t5gemma) models are available through Model Garden.

summary.title: New models available in Model Garden
summary.summary: New models are available in Model Garden, including multimodal MedGemma 27B IT, MedSigLIP, and T5Gemma.

2025-07-11.content:
To reduce the cost of running your inference jobs, you can now use flex-start VMs, which are powered by [Dynamic Workload Scheduler](https://cloud.google.com/blog/products/compute/introducing-dynamic-workload-scheduler). Flex-start VMs offer significant discounts and are well-suited for
short-duration workloads. This feature is available in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

For more information, see [Use DWS flex-start VMs with inference](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/predictions/use-flex-start-vms).

summary.title: New VM option for cheaper inference jobs
summary.summary: You can now use flex-start VMs for your inference jobs to reduce costs. These VMs are powered by Dynamic Workload Scheduler and offer significant discounts, making them ideal for short-duration workloads. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-07-01.content: The global endpoint is generally available (GA) for Anthropic's Claude Opus 4. For details, see [Global endpoint](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/locations#global-endpoint).

summary.title: Claude Opus 4 Now Available Globally
summary.summary: Anthropic's Claude Opus 4 is now generally available through the global endpoint. This feature allows users to access the model from any region.

2025-06-30.content: Mistral Nemo, which is offered as a Model as a Service (MaaS) model in Model Garden, is deprecated. For details, see [Model as a Service (MaaS) deprecations](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/deprecations/partner-models).

summary.title: Mistral Nemo MaaS Deprecation
summary.summary: Mistral Nemo, a Model as a Service (MaaS) offering in Model Garden, has been deprecated. For more information on MaaS deprecations, please refer to the official documentation.

2025-06-30.content: Anthropic's Claude 3 Opus, which is offered as a Model as a Service (MaaS) model in Model Garden, is deprecated. For details, see [Model as a Service (MaaS) deprecations](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/deprecations/partner-models).

summary.title: Claude 3 Opus Deprecation
summary.summary: Anthropic's Claude 3 Opus model offered in Model Garden is now deprecated. For more information, please refer to the Model as a Service (MaaS) deprecations documentation.

2025-06-30.content: Vertex AI online inference now offers Preview support of PSC service automation that can automatically create PSC endpoints for dedicated private endpoints. For more information, see [Create the online inference endpoint with PSC automation](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/predictions/private-service-connect#create-endpoint-with-automation).

summary.title: Vertex AI online inference adds PSC service automation
summary.summary: Vertex AI online inference now supports PSC service automation, which can automatically create PSC endpoints for dedicated private endpoints. This simplifies the process of setting up private endpoints for your online inference needs.

2025-06-30.content: Vertex AI now offers GA support of Private Service Connect Interface and includes Private DNS Peering. For more information, see [Use Private Service Connect interface for Vertex AI Training](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/training/psc-i-egress).

summary.title: Vertex AI Enhances Connectivity with Private Service Connect
summary.summary: Vertex AI now provides general availability support for Private Service Connect interface, which includes Private DNS peering. This enhancement allows for more secure and private connections to Vertex AI services.

2025-06-30.content:
Private Service Connect interface (PSC-I) support for ML pipeline runs in Vertex AI Pipelines is now [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages). PSC-I is recommended for private connectivity because it reduces the chance of IP exhaustion, allows for transitive peering, and includes Private DNS Peering.

For more information, see [Configure Private Service Connect interface for a pipeline](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/pipelines/configure-private-service-connect).

summary.title: Feature Announcement: PSC-I Support for Vertex AI Pipelines
summary.summary: Private Service Connect interface (PSC-I) support for ML pipeline runs in Vertex AI Pipelines.

2025-06-27.content: [Gemma 3n](https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/publishers/google/model-garden/gemma3n) models are now available through Model Garden.

summary.title: Gemma 3n models now in Model Garden
summary.summary: Gemma 3n models are now accessible via Model Garden, offering advanced capabilities for various applications.

2025-06-24.content: The Generative AI module in the Vertex AI SDK is deprecated. For information about migrating to the Google Gen AI SDK, see the [migration guide](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/deprecations/genai-vertexai-sdk).

summary.title: Vertex AI SDK Generative AI module deprecated
summary.summary: The Generative AI module in the Vertex AI SDK has been deprecated. For migration details, please refer to the official migration guide.

2025-06-10.content:
**Vector Search custom constraints with Organization Policy**

You can use custom constraints with the Organization Policy Service to provide more granular control over specific fields for indexes and index endpoints in Vector Search.

For more information, see [Create custom constraints for Vector Search](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/vector-search/custom-constraints).

summary.title: Vector Search custom constraints
summary.summary: You can now use custom constraints with the Organization Policy Service to gain finer control over specific fields for indexes and index endpoints in Vector Search.
